H0.text: DNA is what transgenic organisms possess from a different species, often generated by molecular cloning.

H1.text: Memories are what transgenic organisms possess from a different species, often generated by molecular cloning.

H2.text: Organs are the components that transgenic organisms possess from a different species, and these organisms are often generated by molecular cloning.

H3.text: RNA is what transgenic organisms, often generated by molecular cloning, possess from a different species.

A4.text: Transgene describes a segment of DNA containing a gene sequence that has been isolated from one organism and is introduced into a different organism.

A5.text: The first transgenic organism was created in 1974 when Annie Chang and Stanley Cohen expressed Staphylococcus aureus genes in Escherichia coli.
